titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Holdings at the Litchfield Historical Society
titlestmt.author: Collection Description/Finding Aid prepared by Leith Johnson.

publicationstmt.p: © Copyright 2010 Litchfield Historical Society. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoding in EAD by Archon 2.22 from an SQL database source on May 19th, 2010.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers relating to the Adams family of Litchfield, including Joseph Adams (1764-1856); one of his sons, Charles Adams (1805-1883); and others, consisting primarily of genealogical materials and obituaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers relating to the Adams family of Litchfield, including Joseph Adams (1764-1856); one of his sons, Charles Adams (1805-1883); and others, consisting primarily of genealogical materials and obituaries.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Adams family collection (2010-119-0), Litchfield Historical Society, Helga J. Ingraham Memorial Library, P.O. Box 385, 7 South Street, Litchfield, Connecticut, 06759

odd.head: Other Information
odd.p: This collection was processed with support from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission (NHPRC).
